title: 19.三体、爱因斯坦、单摆、大撕裂
paragraphs: 汪淼第五次进入《三体》时，黎明中的世界已面目全非。前四次均出现的大金字塔已在“三日连珠”中毁灭，在那个位置上出现了一座高大的现代建筑。这幢黑色大楼的样子汪淼很熟悉，那是联合国大厦。远处的大地上，星罗棋布着许多显然是干仓的高大建筑，都有着全反射的镜面表面，在晨光中像大地上生长的巨型水晶植物。
汪淼听见一阵小提琴声，好像是莫扎特的一首曲子，拉得不熟练，但有一种很特别的韵味，仿佛时时在说明，这是拉给自己听的，而自己也很欣赏。琴声来自坐在大厦正门台阶上的一位流浪老人，他蓬松的银发在风中飘着，他脚下放了一顶破礼帽，里面好像已经有人放了些零钱。
汪淼突然发现日出了，但太阳是从与晨光相反方向的地平线下升起的，那里的天穹还是一片漆黑的夜空，太阳升起之前没有任何晨光。太阳很大。升出一半的日轮占据了三分之一的地平线。汪淼的心跳加快了，这么大的太阳，只能意味着又一次大毁灭。但他回头看时，见那位老人仍若无其事地坐在那儿拉琴，他的银发在太阳的光芒中像燃烧起来似的。

这太阳就是银色的，与老人头发一样的颜色，它将一片银光撒向大地，但汪淼从这光芒中感觉不到一点儿暖意。他看看已经完全升出地平线的太阳，从那发出银光的巨盘上，他清晰地看到了木纹状的图形，那是固态的山脉。汪淼明白了，它本身不发光，只是反射从另一个方向发出晨光的真太阳的光芒，升起来的不是太阳，而是一个巨型月亮！巨月运行得很快，以肉眼可以察觉的速度掠过长空，在这个过程中，它逐渐由满月融缺成半月，然后又变成了月牙，老人舒缓的小提琴声在寒冷的晨风中飘荡，宇宙中壮丽的景象仿佛就是那音乐的物化，汪淼陶醉于美的震慑之中。巨大月牙在展光中落下，这时它的亮度增长了很多，当它只剩两个银光四射的尖角在地平线之上时，汪淼突然将其想象成一头正在奔向太阳的宇宙巨牛的两只犄角。
“尊敬的哥白尼，停一停您匆忙的脚步吧，这样您欣赏一曲莫扎特，我也就有了午饭。”巨月完全落下后，老人抬起头来说。
“如果我没认错——”汪淼看着那张满是皱纹的脸说，那些皱纹都很长，曲线也很柔和，像在努力造就一种和谐。
“您没认错，我是爱因斯坦，一个对上帝充满信仰却被他抛弃的可怜人。”
“刚才那个大月亮是怎么回事？我前几次来没有见过它。”
“它已经凉下来了。”
“大月亮啊，我小时候它还热着，升到中天时能看到核心平原上的红光，现在凉下来了……你没听说过大撕裂吗？”
“没有，怎么回事？”
爱因斯坦叹息着摇摇头：“不提了，往事不堪回首，我的过去，文明的过去，宇宙的过去，都不堪回首啊！”
“您怎么落到这个地步？”汪淼掏掏口袋，真的掏出了一些零钱，他弯腰将钱放到帽子里。

“谢谢哥白尼先生，但愿上帝不抛弃您吧，不过我对此没有信心。我感觉，您和牛顿他们到东方用人列运算的那个模型，已很接近于正确了，但所差的那么一点点，对牛顿或其他的人来说是一道不可逾越的鸿沟。我一直认为，没有我，别人也会发现狭义相对论，但广义相对论却不是这样。牛顿差的那一点，就是广义相对论所描述的行星轨道的引力摄动，它引起的误差虽然但对计算结果却是致命的。在经典方程中加入引力摄动的修正，就得到了正确的数学模型。它的运算量比你们在东方完成的要大得多，但对现代计算机来说，真的不成问题。”
“运算结果得到天文观测的证实了吗？”
“要那样我会在这里吗？但从美学角度讲，我是没错的，错的是宇宙。上帝抛弃了我，接着所有的人都抛弃了我，哪里都不要我，普林斯顿撤销了我的教授职位，联合国教科文组织连个科学顾问的职位都不给我，以前他们跪着求我我都不干呢；我甚至想去以色列当总统，可他们说他们改变主意了，说我不过是个骗子，唉——”
爱因斯坦说完又拉起了琴，很精确地从刚才的中断处拉起。汪淼听了一会儿，迈步向大厦的大门走去。
“里面没有人，参加这届联大的所有人都在大厦后面参加单摆启动仪式。”爱因斯坦拉着琴说。

汪淼绕过了大厦，来到它后面，立刻看到了一件不可思议的东西：一架顶天立地的巨型单摆。其实在大厦前面就能看到它露出的一段，但汪淼当时不知道是什么东西。这就是汪淼第一次进入《三体》时，在战国时代的大地上看到的由伏羲建造的那种巨摆，用来给太阳神催眠。眼前这架巨摆外形已经现代化，支撑天桥的两个高塔是全金属结构，每一个都有埃菲尔铁塔那么高，摆锤也是金属的，呈流线型，表面是光滑的电镀镜面，由于有了高强度材料，悬吊摆锤的线缆只有很细的一根，几乎看不到，这使得摆锤看上去像是空悬在两座高塔之间的空中。
在巨摆之下有一群穿着西装的人，可能就是参加联大会议的各国首脑了。他们三五成堆地低声聊着，好像在等待着什么。
“啊，哥白尼，跨越五个时代的人！”有人高声喊道，其他人纷纷对他表示欢迎。
“而且，您是在那战国时代亲眼见过单摆的人！”一个面貌和善的黑人握着汪淼的手说。有人介绍他是本届联合国秘书长。
“是的，我见过，可为什么现在又建起这东西？”汪淼问。
“它是三体纪念碑，也是一个墓碑。”秘书长仰望着半空中的摆锤说，从这里看去，它足有一个潜水艇那么大。
“墓碑？谁的？”
“一个努力的，一个延续了近二百个文明的努力，为解决三体问题的努力，寻找太阳运行规律的努力。”
“这努力终结了吗？”
“到现在为止，彻底终结了。”
汪淼犹豫了一下，拿出了一叠资料，这是魏成三体问题数学模型的链接：“我……就是为此事而来的，我带来了一个解决三体问题的数学模型，据信是很有可能成功。”
汪淼话一出口，发现周围的人立刻对他失去了兴趣，都离开他回到自己的小圈子里继续刚才的聊天，他注意到有的人离开时还笑着摇摇头。秘书长拿过了资料，看也没看就递给了旁边一位戴眼镜的瘦高的人：“出于对您崇高威望的尊敬，请我的科学顾问看看吧。其实大家已经对您表示了这种尊敬，换了别人，会立刻招来嘲笑的。”
科学顾问接过资料翻了翻：“进化算法？哥白尼，你是个天才，能搞出这种算法的人都是天才，这除了高超的数学能力，还需要想象力。”
“听您的意思，已经有人创造了这种数学模型？”
“是的，还有其他几十种数学模型，其中一半以上比您这个要高明得多，都被创造出来，并在计算机上完成了计算。在过去的两个世纪中，这种巨量的计算是世界的中心活动，人们就像等待最后审判日那样等着结果。”
“结果呢？”
“已经确切地证明，三体问题无解。”
汪淼仰望着巨大的摆锤，它在晨曦中晶莹光亮，作为一面变形的镜子反映着周围的一切，仿佛是世界的眸子。在那已被许多个文明所隔开的遥远时代，就在这片大地上，他和周文王曾穿过林立的巨摆走向纣王的宫殿。历史就这样划了一个漫长的大圈，回到了最初的地方。
“正像我们早就精测的那样，三体是一个混沌系统，会将微小的扰动无限放大，其运行规律从数学本质上讲是不可预测的。”科学顾问说。
汪淼感觉自己所有的科学知识和思想体系在一瞬间模糊不清了，代之以前所未有的迷茫：“如果连三体这样极其简单的系统都处于不可预知的混沌，那我们还怎样对探索复杂宇宙的规律抱有信心呢？”
“上帝是个无耻的老赌徒，他抛弃了我们！”爱因斯坦不知什么时候过来了，挥着小提琴说。
秘书长缓缓地点点头：“是的，上帝是个赌徒，那三体文明的唯一希望，就是也赌一把了。”
这时，巨月又从黑夜一方的天边升起，它银色的巨像映在摆锤光滑表面上，光怪陆离地蠕动着，仿佛摆锤和巨月两者之间产生了神秘的心灵感应。
“您说到文明，这一个文明好像已经发展到相当的高度了。”汪淼说。
“是的，掌握了核能，到了信息时代。”秘书长说，但对这一切似乎不以为然。
“那就存在着这样一个希望：文明继续发展下去，达到另一个高度，虽然不能得知太阳运行的规律，但能够在乱纪元生存下去，并且能够抵御以前太阳异常运行造成的那些毁灭性的大灾难。”
“以前人们都是这样想的，这也是三体文明前赴后继顽强再生的动力之一，但它使我们认识到，这一想法是何等的天真。”秘书长指指正在升起的巨月说，“你可能是第一次看到这个巨大的月亮，其实它几乎有我们行星的四分之一大小，已经不是一个月亮，而是这颗行星的一颗伴星了，它是大撕裂的产物。”
“大撕裂？”
“毁灭上一轮文明的大灾难。其实，与以前的文明相比，对这个灾难的预警期还是相当长的。遗留的记载显示，191号文明的天文学家很早就观测到了‘飞星不动’。”

听到最后四个字，汪淼心里一紧。“飞星不动”是三体世界最大的凶兆，飞星，或者说远方的太阳，从地面的观察角度看在宇宙的背景上静止了，只意味太阳与行星在一条直线上运行。这有三种可观能：一、太阳与行星以相同的速度向同一方向运行；二、太阳正远离行星而去，三、太阳正冲向行星而来。在191号文明之前，这只是一种想象中的灾难，从未真实发生过，但人们对它的恐惧和警觉丝毫没有放松，以至于“飞星不动”成了多个三体文明中的一句最不吉利的咒语。即使只有一颗飞星静止，也让人不寒而栗。

“当时，三颗飞星同时静止。191文明的人们站在大地上无助地看着这三颗在正空悬停的飞星，看着向他们的世界直扑过来的三颗太阳。几天后，一个太阳运行到外层气层的可见距离，宁静夜空中，那颗飞星突然变幻成光焰四射的太阳，以三十多小时的间隔，另外两个太阳也相继显形。这不是一般意义上的‘三日凌空’，当最后一颗飞星变成太阳时，第一颗显形的太阳已从极近的距离掠过行星，紧接着，另外两个太阳相继从更近处掠过！三个太阳对行里产生的潮汐力均超过洛希极限（注：法国天文学家洛希证明，任何坚固的天体，在接近另一个比它大得多的天体的时候，都会受到强大的潮汐力作用而最终被扯成碎片。这个较小的天体会被拉碎的距离称为洛希极限。通常是大天体赤道半径的2.44倍）第一颗太阳撼动了行星最深层的地质结构，第二颗太阳在行星上撕开了直通地核的大裂缝，第三颗太阳将行星撕成了两半。”

秘书长指着已升到正空的巨月，“这就是较小的一半，上面有191号文明留下的废墟，但已是一个没有生命的世界。那是三体世界全部历史上最为惊心动魄的灾难，当行星被撕裂后，形状不规则的两部分在自身引力下重新变成球形，灼热致密的行星核心物质涌上地面，海洋在岩浆上沸腾，大陆如消融的流冰般漂浮，它们相撞后，大地变得像海洋般柔软，几万米的巨大山脉可以在一个小时内升起，又在同样短的时间内消失。在一段时间内，行星被撕开的两部分藕断丝连，它们之间有一条横穿太空的岩浆的河流，这些岩浆在太空中冷却，在行星周围形成了一个环，但由于行星两部分的引力扰动，环不稳定，构成它的岩石纷纷坠落，使世界处于长达几世纪的陨石雨中……你能想象那是怎样的地狱啊！这次灾难对生态圈的破坏是所有历史上最严重的一次，伴星上的生命已经灭绝，母星也几乎变成一个没有生命的世界，但生命的种子居然又在这里发芽了，随着母星地质状态的稳定，在面目全非的大陆和海洋中，进化又开始了蹒跚的脚步，直到文明第一百九十二次出现，这个过程，耗时九千万年。
“三体世界所处的宇宙，比我们想象的更加冷酷。下一次‘飞星不动’会怎样？有很大的可能，我们的行星不再从太阳边缘掠过，而是一头扎进太阳的火海中。随着时间的推移，这种可能几乎是必然。”

“这本来只是一个可怕的推测，但最近的一项天文学发现，使我们对三体世界的命运彻底绝望了。这项研究旨在通过这个星系中的一些残留的迹象，推测出星系中恒星和行星形成的历史。无意中发现，三体星系在遥远的时间前曾有过十二颗行星！而现在只剩下我们这一颗，解释只有一个：在漫长的天文纪年中那十一颗行星均被三颗太阳所吞噬！我们的世界，只不过是这场宇宙大捕猎的残余，文明能够经过一百九十二次轮回再生，只不过是一种幸运而已。通过进一步的研究，我们还发现了这三颗恒星的呼吸现象。”
“恒星呼吸？”

“只是一个比喻，您发现了恒星的外围气态层，但您不知道的是，这个气态层以漫长的周期不停地膨胀和收缩，像呼吸一样。当气态层膨胀时，其厚度可以增大十多倍，这使得恒星的直径大大增加，像一个巨掌，更容易捕获到行星。当一颗行星与太阳近距离摩擦过时，就会进入它的气态层，在剧烈的摩擦中急剧减速，最后像一颗流星，拖着长长的火尾坠入太阳的火海。据考证，在三体星系的漫长历史上，太阳气层每膨胀一次，就会吞噬一到两颗行星，那十一颗行星，就是在太阳气态层膨胀到最大时相继坠入火海的。现在，三颗太阳的气态层都处于收缩状态，否则在上次擦阳而过时，我们的行星已经坠落到太阳中了。据学者们的预测，最近的一次膨胀将在一百五万至二百万年后发生。”
“这个鬼地方，实在是待不下去了”爱因斯坦用一个老乞丐的姿势抱着小提琴蹲在地上说。
秘书长点点头说：“待不下去了，也不能再待下去了！三体文明的唯一出路，就是和这个宇宙赌一把。”
“怎么赌？”汪淼问？
“飞出三体星系，飞向广阔的星海，在银河系中寻找可以移民的新世界！”
这时汪淼听到一阵“轧轧”的声音，看到巨大的摆锤正在被旁边一个高架绞车上的一根细缆斜拉着升高，升向它被释放的位置，它后面的天空背景上，一弯巨大的残月正在晨光中下沉。
秘书长庄严宣布：“单摆启动！”

高架绞车松开了将摆锤拉向高处的细缆，巨大的摆锤沿着一条平滑的弧形轨迹无声地滑落下来，开始落得很慢，但迅速加速，到达最低点时速度达到最大，冲破空气发出了浑厚的风声，当这声音消失时，摆锤已沿着同样的弧形轨迹升到了同祥的高度，停滞片刻后开始了新一轮的摆动。汪淼感到摆锤在摆动中仿佛产生了一股巨大的力量，仿佛大地被它拉得摇摇晃晃。与现实世界中的单摆不同，这个巨摆的摆动周期不恒定，时刻在变化中，这是因为围绕母星的巨月产生的重力变化所致：巨月在母星的这一面时，它与母星的引力相互抵消，重力减小；当它运行到母星另一面时，引力叠加，重力几乎恢复到大撕裂之前。
仰望着三体纪念碑气势磅礴的摆动，汪淼问自己：它是表达对规津的渴望，还是对混沌的屈服？汪淼又觉得摆锤像一只巨大的金属拳头，对冷酷的宇宙永恒地挥舞着，无声地发出三体文明不屈的呐喊……当汪淼的双眼被泪水模糊时，他看到了以巨摆为背景出现的字幕：
四百五十一年后，192号文明在双日凌空的烈焰中毁灭，它进化到原子和信息时代。
192号文明是三体文明的里程碑。它最终证明了三体问题的不可解，放弃了已延续191轮文明的徒劳努力，确定了今后文明全新的走向。至此，《三体》游戏的最终目标发生变化，新的目标是：
飞向宇宙，寻找新的家园。
欢迎再次登录。
退出《三体》后，汪淼像每次那样感到十分疲惫，这真是一个累人的游戏，但这次他只休息了半个小时便再次登录。进人《三体》后，在漆黑的背景上，出现了一条意想不到的信息：
情况紧急，《三体》服务器即将关闭，剩余时间自由登录，《三体》将直接转换至最后场景。

definition: (prefix indicating ordinal number, as in 第六[di4 liu4] 'sixth')
(literary) grades in which successful candidates in the imperial examinations were placed
classifier for sections in a building or residential compound
abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

translated_paragraphs: When Wang Miao entered the "Three-body" for the fifth time, the world in the dawn was completely different. The great pyramids that appeared in the previous four entries had been destroyed in the "Three-day Linking Pearls," and a tall modern building had appeared in that position. This black building was familiar to Wang Miao, and it was the United Nations building. Far in the distance, there were many tall buildings on the ground that were obviously dry, with mirror-like reflective surfaces that像大地上生长的 giant crystal plants in the morning light.

汪淼 heard a violin sound, it seemed to be a piece by Mozart, not played very skillfully, but with a very special flavor, as if it were always explaining that it was played for oneself, and one also appreciated it very much. The sound came from an old homeless man sitting on the steps of the main entrance of the building, his silver hair was fluttering in the wind, there was a broken hat under his feet, and it seemed that some coins had been put in it.

Wang Xiaoming suddenly discovered that the sun had risen, but the sun was rising from the horizon in the opposite direction to the dawn, and the sky above was still a pitch-black night sky. There was no dawn before the sun rose. The sun was very large. Half of the sun disk occupied one-third of the horizon. Wang Xiaoming's heart beat faster. Such a large sun could only mean another great destruction. But when he looked back, he saw the old man still sitting there playing the violin as if nothing had happened. His silver hair was like it was burning in the sun's light.

The sun is silver, the same color as the old man's hair, and it spreads a silver light over the earth, but汪淼 feels no warmth from this light. He looks at the fully risen sun, which is shining like a giant disk, and he clearly sees the wood grain pattern on it, which is a solid mountain range.汪淼 understands that it doesn't emit light itself, but only reflects the bright sun's light that comes from another direction. What rises is not the sun, but a giant moon! The moon is moving very quickly, at a speed that can be seen with the naked eye, as it streaks across the sky. In this process, it gradually transforms from a full moon to a half moon, and then to a crescent moon. The old man's soothing violin music floats in the cold morning wind, and the magnificent scenery in the universe seems to be the embodiment of the music.汪淼 is enchanted by the beauty and is mesmerized by it. The giant crescent moon descends in the light, and at this time its brightness has increased greatly. When it只剩下 two silver-shining points on the horizon,汪淼 suddenly imagines it as the two horns of a giant cosmic bull that is running towards the sun.
"Stop your hurried pace, dear Copernicus, and then you can enjoy a Mozart melody, and I will have lunch." The old man said when the full moon had completely set.
"If I'm not mistaken--" Wang淼 said, looking at the face full of wrinkles. Those wrinkles were very long and the curves were also very gentle, like they were trying to create a sense of harmony.
"You're right, I am Einstein, a pitiful man who has been abandoned by God despite his strong faith in him."
"What was that big moon just now? I have never seen it before during my previous visits."
"It has cooled down."
"Who?"
"The big moon, it was still hot when I was a child, and when it rose to the middle of the sky, I could see the red glow on the core plain. Now it's cooled down... Have you heard of the Great Split?"
"No, what's up?"
Einstein shook his head and sighed, "Let's not talk about it. The past is a burden, my past, the past of civilization, the past of the universe, all of it is a burden!"
"What have you come to?" Wang Xiaomiao reached into his pocket and really took out some change. He bent down and put the money into his hat.

"Thank you, Mr. Copernicus, but I do not have confidence that God will not abandon you. However, I do not have confidence in this. I feel that you and Newton and others have come to the East with the model of using lists of arithmetic operations, and you are already very close to the truth. But the little bit that is missing is an insurmountable barrier for Newton or others. I have always believed that if I were not there, others would also discover special relativity, but general relativity is not like this. The error that Newton made was the gravitational perturbation of planetary orbits described by general relativity, which although small in magnitude, is fatal to calculation results. By adding corrections for gravitational perturbations to the classic equations, a correct mathematical model was obtained. Its computational volume is much larger than what you have completed in the East, but for modern computers, it is really not a problem."
"Has the calculation result been confirmed by astronomical observations?"

"Would I be here if I did that? But from an aesthetic point of view, I am not wrong. It is the universe that is wrong. God deserted me, and then everyone deserted me, nowhere wanted me, Princeton withdrew my professorship, UNESCO did not even offer me a scientific advisor position, and I refused to do it even when they knelt down to beg me; I even wanted to go to Israel to be president, but they said they had changed their minds, saying I was just a liar, oh——"

Einstein picked up the violin and started playing again, precisely picking up from where he had left off. Wang Xiaomao listened for a while and started walking towards the main entrance of the building.
"There is no one inside. Everyone who attended this conference is at the back of the building participating in the launch of the pendulum." Einstein played the violin and said.

Wang Xiaowang went around the building and came to its back. He immediately saw an incredible thing: a giant pendulum standing straight up in the air. In fact, a section of it could be seen sticking out in front of the building, but Wang Xiaowang didn't know what it was at the time. This was the giant pendulum that Wang Xiaowang saw for the first time in the Three-body period, when he was in the Zhou Dynasty. It was built by Fu Xi to put the sun god to sleep. The giant pendulum in front of him had been modernized in appearance. The two high towers that supported the skybridge were all-metal structures, each of which was as tall as the Eiffel Tower, and the hammer was also made of metal, in a streamline shape, with a smooth electroplated mirror surface. Thanks to high-strength materials, the suspension cables for the pendulum were only a very thin one, almost invisible, which made the hammer look like it was floating in the air between the two high towers.

Under the giant swing, there is a group of people dressed in suits, who may be the heads of state of various countries attending the U.N. meeting. They chat in groups of three or five in low voices, as if waiting for something.
"Aah, Copernicus, the man who crossed five eras!" someone shouted loudly, while others welcomed him warmly.

"And you, sir, are one of the few people alive today who have actually seen a simple pendulum in action during the Warring States period!" said a friendly-looking black man holding onto Wang淼's hand. He introduced himself as the Secretary-General of the United Nations.
"Yes, I've seen it before, but why is it being built now?" Wang淼 asked.
"It is the Three-body Memorial and a tombstone." Secretary General looked up at the pendulum in the air and said, from this perspective, it was as big as a submarine.
"Grave marker? Whose?"
"A diligent one, an effort that has lasted nearly two hundred civilizations, an effort to solve the Three-body problem, and an effort to find the规律 of the sun's movement."
"Is this effort coming to an end?"
"Up until now, it has been completely terminated."
汪淼 hesitated for a moment, took out a stack of materials, and said, "I... came here for this. I bring a mathematical model for the Three-body problem, which is believed to be very likely to succeed."

As soon as Wang Xiaoming spoke, he found that the people around him immediately lost interest in him and returned to their own small circles to continue their previous conversations. He noticed that some people left with a smile and shook their heads. The Secretary General took the materials and looked at them without even opening them and handed them to a tall, bespectacled man next to him: "Out of respect for your崇高威望, please let my scientific advisor take a look. In fact, everyone has expressed this kind of respect for you. If someone else had done this, they would have been laughed at."

The scientific advisor took the资料 and flipped through it: "Evolutionary algorithm? Copernicus, you're a genius. People who can come up with such algorithms are all geniuses. This not only requires superb mathematical abilities, but also imagination."
Does it mean that someone has created such a mathematical model already?

"Yes, there are dozens of other mathematical models, more than half of which are much smarter than yours, and have been created and completed on computers. In the past two centuries, this massive calculation has been the center of the world's activities, and people have been waiting for the results with the same anticipation as waiting for the last judgment day."
"What was the result?"
"The three-body problem has been proven to be unsolvable."

汪淼 looked up at the massive pendulum, it was glistening in the morning light, reflecting everything around it like a distorted mirror, as if it were the eyes of the world. In those distant times that were already separated by many civilizations, he and Zhou Weizhao had walked through the towering pendulums towards the palace of King Zhou. Thus, history made a long circle and returned to its starting point.

"The Three-body Problem is a chaotic system, which will amplify tiny perturbations infinitely, and its运行规律 from a mathematical perspective is fundamentally unpredictable," the scientific advisor said.

Wang Xiaomao felt that all of his scientific knowledge and thought systems were suddenly unclear, replaced by an unprecedented confusion: "If even such a simple system as Three Body is in an unpredictable chaotic state, how can we still have confidence in exploring the规律 of complex宇宙?"
"God is a shameless old gambler who abandoned us!" Einstein appeared suddenly and said with a violin in his hand.
The Secretary-General nodded slowly: "Yes, God is a gambler. The only hope for the Three-body civilization is to bet as well."

At this time, the giant moon rose from the distant east of the night sky, casting its silver giant image on the smooth surface of the pendulum, wiggling bizarrely, as if there was a mysterious mind-to-heart resonance between the pendulum and the giant moon.
"You mentioned civilization. This civilization seems to have developed to a very high level." Wang淼 said.
"Yes, with nuclear energy, we have entered the information age," the Secretary-General said, but seemed unconvinced by all this."

"There is a hope that civilization continues to develop and reaches a higher level, even though we cannot know the rules for the sun's operation. We can survive and resist the catastrophic disasters caused by the abnormal operation of the sun in the chaotic era."

"The people used to think so, and this was one of the driving forces behind the successive renewal of the Three-body civilization. But it made us realize how naive this idea was." The Secretary-General pointed to the huge moon that was rising and said, "You may be the first to see this huge moon. In fact, it is almost four times the size of our planet, and it is no longer a moon, but a star of this planet, a product of the Great Split."
"Great Divide?"

"The great disaster that destroyed the previous civilization. In fact, the warning period for this disaster is still relatively long compared to previous civilizations. The remaining records show that the astronomers of the 191st civilization observed the "fixed star does not move" very early."

At the end of the last four words, Wang Xiaomiao's mind tightened. "The stilling of the flying star" is the greatest ominous sign in the Three-body world. The flying star, or the distant sun, appears stationary in the universe's background from the perspective of the ground, meaning that the sun and planets are running in a straight line. There are three possible observable energies: 1. The sun and planets are running in the same direction at the same speed; 2. The sun is moving away from the planet; 3. The sun is moving towards the planet. Prior to the 191th civilization, this was only an imaginary disaster that had never actually happened, but people's fear and vigilance towards it did not ease up in the slightest, and as a result, "the stilling of the flying star" became a most ominous curse in multiple Three-body civilizations. Even if only one flying star is still, it is still terrifying.

"At that time, three stars simultaneously froze in place. The people of the 191 civilization stood on the ground helplessly and watched as three stars hung motionless in the center of the sky, as three suns approached their world. A few days later, one of the suns reached the outer atmosphere's visible distance, and in the quiet night sky, the star suddenly changed into a blazing sun, appearing every 30 or so hours, followed by the other two suns. This was not a usual "three suns in the sky" phenomenon. When the last star turned into a sun, the first sun had already passed close to the planet from a very close distance, and immediately, the other two suns passed even closer! The tidal forces generated by the three suns exceeded the Roche limit (Note: French astronomer Roche proved that any solid celestial body that approaches another much larger celestial body will be subjected to extremely strong tidal forces and ultimately be torn apart. The distance at which the smaller body is torn apart is called the Roche limit. It is usually twice the equatorial radius of the larger body). The first sun shook the planet's deepest geological structure, the second sun sliced a straight channel through the planet to the core, and the third sun split the planet in two."

The Secretary-General pointed to the giant moon that had risen to the center of the sky, "This is the smaller half, with ruins left by the 191th civilization. But it is a world without life. That was the most shocking disaster in the entire history of the Three-body world. When the planet was torn apart, the two irregular parts re-formed into spheres under their own gravity, and the hot and dense core of the planet rose to the ground, the ocean boiled on the ground, the continents drifted like melting ice, and they collided, making the land like the ocean, soft and malleable, and thousands of meters of towering mountains could rise and fall in an hour. For a period of time, the two parts of the planet were connected by a river of molten rock in space, and these molten rocks cooled in space and formed a ring around the planet. However, due to the gravitational disturbances of the two parts of the planet, the ring was unstable, and the rocks composing it fell, putting the world under a meteor shower for several centuries. Can you imagine what kind of hell that was! This disaster was the most severe in the history of the ecosystem. Life on the satellite has been extinct, and the mother planet is almost a world without life. But the seeds of life have sprouted again here. With the stability of the mother planet's geology, evolution began to take slow steps on the transformed continents and oceans. It took nine hundred million years for the process to reach civilization one hundred and ninety-second.

"The universe in which the Three-Body World exists is even colder than we imagine. What will happen next in the "Frigate不动"? There is a very high possibility that our planet will no longer pass by the edge of the sun, but will head straight into the sun's fiery inferno. As time passes, this possibility is almost inevitable."

"This was originally just a terrifying speculation, but a recent astronomical discovery has completely dashed our hopes for the fate of the Three-body World. The study aimed to infer the history of star and planet formation in this galaxy through some residual signs in the galaxy. Unintentionally, the Three-body Galaxy had twelve planets in the distant past! And now there is only one left, and the explanation is simple: over a long period of astronomical history, the eleven planets were all devoured by the three suns! Our world is just a residue of this cosmic hunt. Civilizations can survive one hundred and ninety-two reincarnations, but it is only a stroke of luck. Through further research, we also discovered the breathing phenomenon of these three stars."
"恒星呼吸？" translates to "Stellar breathing?" in English.

It's just a metaphor. You discovered the outer gas layer of a star, but you don't know that this gas layer expands and contracts in a long cycle, like breathing. When the gas layer expands, its thickness can increase by more than ten times, which makes the diameter of the star much larger, like a giant hand, making it easier to capture planets. When a planet gets too close to the sun and collides with it, it will enter its gas layer and slow down rapidly in the violent friction. Finally, like a meteor, it拖着 a long tail of fire and falls into the sun's fire sea. According to historical records, every time the gas layer of the Three-body System expands, it devours one to two planets. The eleven planets were devoured by the sun's gas layer when it expanded to its maximum. Now, the gas layers of the three suns are in a state of contraction, or else our planet would have fallen into the sun during the last passage. According to the predictions of scholars, the next expansion will occur in 1.5 to 2 million years.
"This鬼地方，实在是待不下去了." Einstein said, crouching on the ground with a beggar's pose and holding the violin.
The Secretary-General nodded and said, "We can't stay any longer, and we can't stay any longer! The only way for the Three-body civilization to survive is to bet on this universe."
"How do you bet?" Wang淼问。
"Fly out of the Three Body System, fly towards the vast starry sea, and search for a new world for immigration in the Milky Way Galaxy!"

At this time, Wang Xiaomao heard a "轧轧" sound and saw a giant pendulum being raised by a thin cable attached to a gantry crane on the side. It was being lifted towards its released position, and behind the sky background, a huge crescent moon was sinking into the morning light.
The Secretary-General solemnly announced, "The pendulum is set in motion!"

The high-tension hoist released the pendulum, pulling it upwards along a slender cable. The massive pendulum glided silently down along a smooth arc, starting slow but quickly gaining speed. At its lowest point, it reached its maximum velocity, breaking the air with a deep, resounding roar. As the sound faded away, the pendulum had returned to the same height along the same arc, pausing briefly before beginning its新一轮 swing. Wang淼 felt as if the pendulum was generating an enormous force as it swung, as if the earth was being tugged back and forth. Unlike a simple pendulum in the real world, the swing of this giant pendulum was not constant, constantly changing as it was affected by the gravitational changes caused by the giant moon orbiting the star. When the moon was on the star's opposite side, its gravitational force canceled out the star's, reducing gravity; when it reached the star's other side, the gravitational forces combined, nearly restoring gravity to its state before the great divergence.

Looking up at the majestic swaying of the Three-body Memorial, Wang淼 asked himself: Is it a manifestation of longing for regulation, or submission to chaos? Wang淼 also felt that the pendulum was like a huge metal fist, swinging永恒地 in the face of the cold and cruel universe,发出无声的三体文明不屈的呐喊... When Wang淼's eyes were blurred by tears, he saw the subtitle appear in the background of the giant pendulum:
Four hundred and fifty-one years later, in the year 192, the civilization on planet 192 was destroyed in a blaze of fire from the twin suns. It had evolved into the atomic and information ages.

The 192th civilization is a milestone of the Three-body civilization. It ultimately proved that the Three-body problem is unsolvable, abandoned the futile efforts of the 191st civilization延续, and determined the new direction for future civilizations. Thus, the ultimate goal of the Three-body game changed, and the new goal is:
Fly into space and seek a new home.
Welcome to log in again.
Sure, I can do that. Please provide the Chinese text you would like me to translate.

After exiting "The Three-Body Problem," Wang Xiaomao felt as exhausted as usual, and this was truly a tiring game. However, this time he only rested for half an hour before logging in again. After entering "The Three-Body Problem," an unexpected message appeared on the dark background:
紧急情况，《三体》服务器即将关闭，剩余时间自由登录，《三体》将直接转换至最后场景。
en_translation_qwen_7b_chat: When Wang淼 entered the "Three-body" for the fifth time, the world in the dawn was completely different. The large pyramids that appeared in the previous four times were destroyed by the "Three Days of Star", and a tall modern building appeared in that position. This black building that Wang淼 was very familiar with was the UN Building. Far away on the ground, there were many seemingly dry storages with towering buildings, all reflecting light like giant crystal plants growing on the ground.

Wang Moxi heard the sound of a violin, which seemed to be a Mozart piece, played poorly but with a special flavor. It seemed to keep saying that it was played for oneself, and one also appreciated it. The sound came from an old beggar sitting on the steps of the main gate of the building, his silver hair swaying in the wind, a broken hat under his feet, inside which someone had already put some coins.

Wang Xiaoming suddenly found the sun rising, but it was rising from the opposite direction of the horizon, and the sky there was still a pitch-black night sky with no morning light. The sun was very large. Half of the sun disk had occupied one-third of the horizon. Wang Xiaoming's heartbeat quickened, such a big sun could only mean another great destruction. But when he looked back, he saw that the old man was still sitting there playing the violin, his silver hair burning like fire in the sunshine.

The sun is silver, the color of old man's hair, it pours down a silver light upon the earth, but Wang Mou didn't feel any warmth from this light. He looked at the sun that had already risen above the horizon and saw the wood grain patterns on the giant disk from which the light was emitted. He understood that it itself did not shine, but only reflected the light sent in another direction by the true sun that rises; it was not a sun rising, but a giant moon! The moon moved quickly, its brightness increasing at an observable speed as it swept across the sky. During this process, it gradually evolved from full to half moon, then crescent moon, and finally into a slender crescent. Old man's smooth violin music drifted through the cold morning breeze, and the magnificent sights in the universe seemed to be a physical manifestation of the music. Wang Mou was intoxicated with the beauty of the spectacle. As the bright crescent descended, its brightness increased greatly. When only two shining silver horns remained above the horizon, he suddenly imagined them as the horns of a cosmic bull heading towards the sun.
"Dear Copernicus, stop your hasty steps for a while so that you can enjoy a Mozart piece and I will have lunch too," the old man said after the giant moon had fully set."
"If I'm not mistaken --" said Wang Mo, looking at the wrinkled face. The wrinkles were long and curving, striving for harmony.
"You're not mistaken, I am Einstein, a pitiful man who believes in God but was abandoned by him."
"What's that big moon? I've never seen it before during my previous visits."
"It's cooled down."
"Who?"

"The big moon, it was still hot when I was a child, and when it rose to the middle sky, we could see the red light on the plain of the core. It's cooled down now... Have you heard about the Great Split?"
"What's up? Why not?"
Einstein shook his head sighed and said, "I won't mention it anymore. My past, the past of civilization, the past of the universe - they're all unbearable to recall!"
"What on earth happened to you?" Wang Mozi patted his pockets and really pulled out some loose change, bending down to place it into his hat.

"Thank you, Mr. Copernicus. I hope God does not abandon you, but I have no faith in it. I feel that your model of using the differential equation to calculate planetary orbits in China is very close to the truth, but there is only a little difference, which is an insurmountable barrier for Newton or others.
